intro: Drosanthemum attenuatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and come in shades of red, yellow, and orange. Drosanthemum attenuatum is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
